Comparing Files and Resolving Differences

To locate unresolved files in View Manager, you can use the options on the Find menu or their corresponding toolbar buttons.

  • After a preview operation, double-clicking text file names in the lower pane displays the files in a comparison utility.

  • After a synchronization operation, double-clicking text file names displays a merge utility.

Resolving Text Files

After a View Manager operation, the icon for unresolved files displays for any pair of corresponding text files that require merging. They have the result state "Manual merge required."

To compare or resolve text files:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • Select Find > Next Manual Merge or Find > Previous Manual Merge from the menu bar.

    • Click the Find Next Manual Merge button or the Find Previous Manual Merge button on the toolbar.

    These actions locate a set of unresolved corresponding files.

  2. Double-click the file name.

  3. Do one of the following:

    • Use the comparison utility to review these files. See the Using Visual Diff section of the Help system.

    • Use the merge utility to resolve the conflicts or differences between these files. See the Using Visual Merge section of the Help system.

Resolving Binary Files

Unresolved binary files can be located using the options on the Find menu or their corresponding toolbar buttons. These files are also flagged, but double-clicking them does not display a merge utility. Instead, it displays a "Merge operation failed" message, because View Manager cannot merge binary files. Often, you can use the applications with which the binary files were created to compare them and resolve their differences.
